qas.question: Von Neumann's study of what preceded the discovery of DNA?

answers.text: mathematical analysis of the structure of self-replication

qas.question: What part of his work did Von Neumann consider to be his most important?
What work did Von Nemann do in Berlin in 1930 and Princeton 1935 - 39?
What was the topic of Von Neumann's work at Princeton in 1931 - 32?

context: Von Neumann's <a0_0>mathematical analysis of the structure of self-replication<a0_0/> preceded the discovery of the structure of DNA. In a short list of facts about his life he submitted to the National Academy of Sciences, he stated "The part of my work I consider most essential is that on <a1_0>quantum mechanics<a1_0/>, which developed in <a2_0>Göttingen<a2_0/> in 1926, and subsequently in Berlin in 1927–1929. Also, my work on various forms of <a3_0>operator theory<a3_0/>, Berlin 1930 and Princeton 1935–1939; on the <a4_0>ergodic theorem<a4_0/>, Princeton, 1931–1932."
